description: From Latin dextrorsum, contracted from dextrovorsum, dextroversum (“toward the right side”), from dexter (“right”) + versus, vorsus, past participle of vertere, vortere (“to turn”).

adjectives.description: dextrorse (comparative more dextrorse, superlative most dextrorse)

entries.meaning: Turning from the left to the right, in the ascending line, as in the spiral inclination of the stem of the morning glory.
